action.action-desc: Mr. Posey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 to authorize the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to enter into reimbursable fee agreements for the provision of additional services at Customs ports of entry, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Services to Allow New Destinations for Tourism Act or STAND for Tourism Act .

section.header: Reimbursable fee agreements for provision of additional Customs services

subsection.text: Section 13031 of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (19 U.S.C. 58c) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Reimbursable fee agreements for provision of additional Customs services

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, and upon the request of any person requesting Customs services, the Commissioner may enter into an agreement with such person under which the person agrees to pay a fee to reimburse U.S. Customs and Border Protection for the provision of additional services and any other costs incurred by U.S. Customs and Border Protection relating to such services at Customs ports of entry.
Funds collected pursuant to any agreement entered into under this subsection—

subparagraph.text: shall be credited to accounts that may be established by the Commissioner for the provision of U.S. Customs and Border Protection services and remain available until expended for the purposes described in paragraph (1), without fiscal year limitation; and

shall be used to pay any expenses incurred by U.S. Customs and Border Protection in providing additional Customs services and any other costs incurred by U.S. Customs and Border Protection relating to such services at Customs ports of entry.

paragraph.text: The amount of the fee to be charged pursuant to an agreement entered into under this subsection shall be paid by each person requesting additional Customs services and shall include the salary and expenses of individuals employed by U.S. Customs and Border Protection to provide such Customs services and other costs incurred by U.S. Customs and Border Protection relating to such services at Customs ports of entry, such as temporary placement or permanent relocation of those individuals.
Any person who, after notice and demand for payment of any fee charged under subsection (a) of this section, fails to pay such fee in a timely manner shall—

subparagraph.text: be guilty of a misdemeanor, and if convicted thereof shall pay a fine that does not exceed an amount equal to 200 percent of such fee in addition to court costs; and
be liable for a penalty or liquidated damage equal to 2 times the amount of the fee in addition to court costs.

paragraph.continuation-text: Any amount collected pursuant to this paragraph shall be deposited into 1 or more of the accounts established under paragraph (2) and shall be available as described therein.

paragraph.text: Each facility at which such Customs services are performed shall provide, maintain, and equip, without cost to the Federal Government, such facilities in accordance with U.S. Customs and Border Protection specifications.

subparagraph.text: the term Commissioner means the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection of the Department of Homeland Security; and

clause.text: a corporation, partnership, trust, association, or any other public or private entity, including any foreign government or transit authority, or any officer, employee, or agent thereof.

paragraph.text: Section 13031(e)(2)(A) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (19 U.S.C. 58c(e)(2)(A)) is amended by adding at the end before the period the following: , or any agreement entered into pursuant to subsection (l) of this section .
The amendment made by paragraph (1) shall take effect on October 1, 2013.
